abstract.t: When dealing with large amounts of keys the procedures to update a zone and to sign a zone need to be clearly defined and practically possible. The current idea is to have the KEY RR and the parent's SIG to reside in the child's zone and perhaps also in the parent's zone. We feel that this would lead to very complicated procedures for large TLDs. We propose an alternative scheme in which the parent zone stores the parent's signature over the child's key and also a copy of the child's key itself.
